pages.text: Pulmonoscorpius is an extinct large scorpion from the middle Carboniferous period. Its name comes from the latin 'pulmonis' meaning lung, and Greek 'skorpios,' a scorpion. Pulmonoscorpius had a body plan similar to extant scorpions and is thought to have preyed on smaller arthropods.
